title: U.S. bond yields slip ahead of PCE inflation report, Brainard speech
text:
* The yield on the 2-year Treasury BX:TMUBMUSD02Y fell 7 basis points to 4.14%.

* The yield on the 10-year Treasury BX:TMUBMUSD10Y declined 8 points to 3.70%.

* The yield on the 30-year Treasury BX:TMUBMUSD30Y fell 8 basis points to 3.65%.

What's driving markets

The personal consumption expenditure price index for August that the Fed uses to target inflation is due for release Friday at 8.30 a.m. ET, along with consumer spending and personal income numbers. Shortly after the stock-market opens, the Chicago PMI and the final University of Michigan consumer sentiment reading will be released also.

Fed Vice Chair Lael Brainard headlines another wave of comments by policy makers on Friday.

Yields on the 2-year Treasury have jumped for 13 of the past 16 sessions, while the yield for both the 10-year and the 30-year Treasury settled Thursday at the third highest level of the year.

The yield curve bearishly flattened aftersurprisingly strong U.S. jobless benefit claims data on Thursday.

"To the extent that more slack in labor markets was one of the preconditions necessary Chair Powell mentioned last week that would support slowing and eventually ending the hiking cycle, and that the 4-week average of jobless claims has retraced significantly lower in the last two months, it's not unsurprising the curve reacted as it did to this data point," said rates strategists at JPMorgan.

U.S. bond yields slip ahead of PCE inflation report, Brainard speech
